body.p: I had not the honour of being acquainted with the late Mr. MacFarlane,James Macfarlan (1832-62; Dictionary of National Biography), Glasgow poet and pedlar; CD published 10 of his poems in All the Year Round, 12 Nov 59-2 Feb 61 (Pilgrim Letters 9, p. 504 & nn). He died in Glasgow, leaving a wife and children. but I would willingly have signed the Memorial certifying to his literary merits, if I had not already signed three other MemorialsThe Memorials not identified strongly pressing the MinisterBenjamin Disraeli, Prime Minister since Feb 1868. for pensions. So long as those cases remain undisposed of, I should consider it unreasonable on my part to urge others.
